column4: For some reason, I can't get the installer to use my free space: ï»¿http://farm4.static.flickr.com/3547/3326358951_de20690052_b.jpg
use manual then :)
no, use full manual
use manual partitioning and you can use the unallocated space to make (at least) / and /swap
thats fine if the unpartitioned space is what you wish to use
if you want full control use manual again and you can create partitions as you like
read the screen, the white bit is unallocated
yes you need to click manual then click next
not if manual is selected
you need to create 2 partitions in that free space, / and /swp. make swp about 1Gb and use the rest for /
looks fine
So, next then?
write the partitions to the disk and continue with the install
Thanks for saving my newb hide again
let the install do its thing, it will say when its done
check the bootup settings
whatever makes your pc boot
check the bootup options in bios as well as the options in the bootloader, make sure its not using the ubuntu iso as boot
or whatever
It'd be odd if it was, since I pulled out the SD card when prompted to, before restart
strange, could try putting the card in and tell the card to boot from the hard drive
